sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词均含"古代的，古老的"之意。
means: ancient ：指很久以前发生或存在的事物。用于描述历史时，指远古时代。
old ：指长期以来一直存在着的事物，与times连用指古代，与days连用时指从前或旧社会。
antique ：指已经很古老或颇有古风的事物，一般都具有较高价值。

sentence.Network_en: No matter where you go in life or how old you get, there's always something new to learn about. After all, life is full of surprises.
sentence.Network_cn: 不管你生活在哪里，你有多少岁，总有新东西要学习，毕竟，生活总是充满惊喜。

sentence.Network_en: As a group, today's old people are still relatively deprived.
sentence.Network_cn: 总的来说，当今的老年人依然相对贫困。

sentence.Network_en: Douglas was a 29-year-old journeyman fighter, erratic in his previous fights.
sentence.Network_cn: 道格拉斯29岁，是个技术不错的拳击手，在以前的比赛中发挥不太稳定。

jx.jx_en_mean: any item of a specified type (used to show that no particular or special individual is in question)
jx.jx_cn_mean: （用于表示无特殊个体）任意一个

lj.lj_ly: any old room would have done.
they've dropped things just any old how.

jx.jx_en_mean: of very long standing or very great age (often used in exaggerated statements)
in or belonging to the past

lj.lj_ly: he was more reticent than of old.

jx.jx_en_mean: starting long ago; for a long time
a period in the past, often seen as significantly different from the present, especially noticeably better or worse

lj.lj_ly: it was easier in the old days.
we are less confident than in the good old days.
lj.lj_ls: 我们不像从前好日子里那么自信了。

lj.lj_ly: the bad old days of incoherence and irresponsibility.
lj.lj_ls: 过去那些松散、不负责任的糟糕日子。

jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)老得可以当某人的父亲（或母亲）

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English ald, of West Germanic origin; related to Dutch oud and German alt, from an Indo-European root meaning 'grown-up, adult', shared by Latin alere 'nourish'

entry.tran: 年老的；年纪大的；不年轻的
entry.def: Someone who is old has lived for many years and is no longer young.

example.ex: ...a white-haired old man...
example.tran: 白发老人

example.ex: He was considered too old for the job.
example.tran: 他被认为年纪太大,不适合做这份工作。

entry.def: You use old to talk about how many days, weeks, months, or years someone or something has lived or existed.

example.ex: He was abandoned by his father when he was three months old...
example.tran: 他3个月大的时候被父亲遗弃了。

example.ex: The paintings in the chapel were perhaps a thousand years old...
example.tran: 小教堂里的这些画可能有1,000年的历史了。

entry.tran: 古老的；长久的；历史悠久的
entry.def: Something that is old has existed for a long time.

example.ex: She loved the big old house...
example.tran: 她喜欢这幢古老的大房子。

example.ex: These books must be very old.
example.tran: 这些书肯定有好些年头了。

entry.def: Something that is old is no longer in good condition because of its age or because it has been used a lot.

example.ex: He took a bunch of keys from the pocket of his old corduroy trousers.
example.tran: 他从破旧的灯芯绒裤子口袋里掏出一串钥匙。

example.ex: ...an old toothbrush.
example.tran: 一把旧牙刷

entry.tran: 旧时的；过去的；从前的；过时的
entry.def: You use old to refer to something that is no longer used, that no longer exists, or that has been replaced by something else.

example.ex: The old road had disappeared under grass and heather...
example.tran: 从前的那条路已经消失在杂草和欧石南丛中。

example.ex: Although the old secret police have been abolished, the military police still exist...
example.tran: 虽然旧时的秘密警察业已废除，但宪兵队依然存在。

entry.tran: 原来（属于自己）的；原先（生活中）的
entry.def: You use old to refer to something that used to belong to you, or to a person or thing that used to have a particular role in your life.

example.ex: I'll make up the bed in your old room...
example.tran: 我会把你原来房间的床铺整理好。

example.ex: I still have affection for my old school...
example.tran: 我依然眷恋着母校。

entry.tran: （朋友）相识已久的；（敌人）结有宿怨的；（对手）长期竞争的
entry.def: An old friend, enemy, or rival is someone who has been your friend, enemy, or rival for a long time.

example.ex: I called my old friend John Horner...
example.tran: 我给老朋友约翰·霍纳打了电话。

example.ex: Mr Brownson, I assure you King's an old enemy of mine...
example.tran: 布朗森先生，我向你保证金是我的老冤家。

entry.def: You can use old to express affection when talking to or about someone you know.

example.ex: Are you all right, old chap?...
example.tran: 你还好吗，老家伙？

example.ex: Good old Bergen would do him the favor.
example.tran: 好心肠的老伯根会帮他这个忙的。

entry.tran: 随便哪个/不是随便哪个
entry.def: You use any old to emphasize that the quality or type of something is not important. If you say that a particular thing is not any old thing, you are emphasizing how special or famous it is.

example.ex: Any old paper will do...
example.tran: 随便一张旧报纸就行。

example.ex: The portraits and sumptuous ornaments, and the gold clock, show that this is not just any old front room.
example.tran: 墙上挂的画像、奢华的装饰和那座金钟都表明这可不是一间普普通通的客厅。

entry.def: In the old days means in the past, before things changed.

example.ex: In the old days we got a visit from the vet maybe once a year.
example.tran: 以前，兽医大概每年来我们这里出诊一次。

entry.tran: 往昔的好日子；过去的好时光
entry.def: When people refer to the good old days, they are referring to a time in the past when they think that life was better than it is now.

example.ex: He remembers the good old days when everyone in his village knew him and you could leave your door open at night.
example.tran: 他还记得村里人互相熟识、可以夜不闭户的美好往昔。

entry.def: If you talk about people or things of old, you are referring to people or things that existed long ago but which no longer exist, or no longer exist in the same form.

example.ex: ...the warrior knights of old.
example.tran: 旧时骁勇善战的骑士

example.ex: ...a programme of work to recreate the Sherwood Forest of old.
example.tran: 重现古时舍伍德森林的工程

means.word_mean: 1. past times (especially in the phrase `in days of old')

1. (used especially of persons) having lived for a relatively long time or attained a specific age; especially not young; often used as a combining form to indicate an age as specified as in `a week-old baby';

sentences.sentence: "an old man's eagle mind"--William Butler Yeats

means.word_mean: 5. lacking originality or spontaneity; no longer new;
6. just preceding something else in time or order;

sentences.sentence: "went upriver to look at a sure-enough fish wheel"

list.explanation: 老古话，民间流传的格言

auth_sentence.content: Even in old age, Walter was pretty scary.
auth_sentence.res_content: Even in old age, Walter was pretty scary.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Even in old age, Walter was pretty scary.

auth_sentence.content: It's like old-school soul only with up-to-date instruments.
auth_sentence.res_content: It's like old-school soul only with up-to-date instruments.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It's like old-school soul only with up-to-date instruments.

auth_sentence.content: It has little to do with boring old-fashioned rock.
auth_sentence.res_content: It has little to do with boring old-fashioned rock.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It has little to do with boring old-fashioned rock.

sentences.en: He gets tax relief because he supports his old mother.
sentences.cn: 他因赡养年迈的母亲而得以减税。

means.word_mean: 古老的; 古代的, 陈旧的

sentences.en: It's just an old rag I had in the closet.
sentences.cn: 这只不过是我挂在壁橱里的旧衣服罢了。

sentences.en: He posed as an expert on old coins.
sentences.cn: 他假装是个古钱币专家。

sentences.en: This pine is a hundred years old.

means.word_mean: 早已认识的; 熟悉的

sentences.en: I met with an old friend at a dinner party.
sentences.cn: 我在一次宴会上偶然遇到一位老朋友。

sentences.en: She got her old job back.
That child seems old beyond his years.
sentences.cn: 那个孩子看上去比他的实际年龄老成。

jushi.english: In order to save younger men's jobs, some of the older workers were retired early.
jushi.chinese: 为了保证年轻人有工作,一些老年人早些退休了。

jushi.english: The old woman couldn't forget her dead mate.
jushi.chinese: 那位老妇人无法忘记她已故的丈夫。

jushi.english: The old man lived in a little house in the woods.
jushi.chinese: 那老人住在森林中的一间小房里。
